channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for ID
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for ID

item.title: Report E-2023120452
item.description:
Report E-2023120452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-12
  • City: POCATELLO
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ERTS was contacted about a twenty-five-gallon spill of a UN1866 resin solution that was released at Terminal. The caller stated that (1) fifty-five-gallon metal drum containing the material was punctured by a forklift during offloading impacting Trailer. No Drains, Soils or water ways were impacted.

item.title: Report X-2023120914
item.description:
Report X-2023120914

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: BOISE
  • State: ID
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: AM QA discovered package leaking in unload. Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent. DescribePack: The package had 5 plastic bottle containers of liquid monomer and one had a loose cap and half of the bottle spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Employee put on proper PPE. Package was contained and placed in a lined hazmat bin. Bin was then placed in Hazmat cage under the air vent.
